paper_abstract: Given a set P of n points in the plane, where n is even, we consider the following question: How many plane perfect matchings can be packed into P ? For points in general position we prove the lower bound of left perpendicularlog(2) nright perpendicular - 1. For some special configurations of point sets, we give the exact answer. We also consider some restricted variants of this problem.
paper_title: Packing Plane Perfect Matchings into a Point Set
